title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: JSW Steel CEO on met coke import curbs
items.summary:
- *JSW Steel* CEO says they are **self-sufficient on met-coke** and not facing shortages, even as other mills rely on imports.
- The government extended the met-coke curbs with country quotas and a cap of about 1.4 million tons for Jul-Dec, prompting calls for a near sevenfold increase.
- Imports of low-ash metallurgical coke from China, Japan, Indonesia, Poland and Switzerland have surged, pressuring producers to boost domestic sourcing.

items.title: IMFA to buy Tata Steel's ferro chrome plant in Odisha
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- IMFA signed definitive agreements to acquire Tata Steel's ferro chrome plant at Kalinganagar, Odisha for **₹610 crore**, adding **99 MVA** furnace capacity and pushing IMFA beyond **0.5 mtpa**. 
- The 115-acre facility has four furnaces (100,000 tpa each) with potential to reach 150,000 tpa after a fifth furnace, near **chrome ore mines** for cost synergies. 
- Regulatory approvals are pending and the deal is expected to close in about three months; IMFA MD Subhrakant Panda called it **transformational** and said funding would be from **internal accruals**.

items.title: Adani Ports eye 5x logistics revenue by 2029
items.summary:
- APSEZ targets **₹140 billion** in logistics revenue by **FY2029**, five times FY2025, as it expands into *warehousing* and *port-feeder services*.
- Logistics revenue rose **79%** YoY to **11.5%** of total revenue; total revenue reached **₹91.67 billion** and cargo volumes hit **124 million tonnes** on strong domestic demand.
- Diversification hedges against global trade risk, strengthening Adani Ports with multi-revenue streams for long-term resilience.

items.title: Skyworks forecasts upbeat results on mobile-chip demand
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Skyworks forecasts Q1 revenue of **$975 million to $1.03 billion** and **$1.40 per share** in adjusted earnings, above estimates.
- For Q4, revenue was **$1.10 billion**, beating estimates around **$978 million**.
- Growth is driven by **5G iPhones**, AI-enabled devices, and Skyworks' role as a key RF-chip supplier, with potential Qorvo consolidation.

items.title: AMD forecasts fourth-quarter revenue above estimates on strong AI chip demand
Nexperia unsure 'if and when' China unit will send chips, letter to customers says
items.summary:
- *Nexperia* says it cannot "oversee if and when products" from its *Dongguan* site will be delivered and cannot guarantee their quality until it regains supply‑chain oversight.
- The letter describes a formal **force majeure** notification amid the Dutch seizure and long‑standing **global trade tensions** involving Wingtech’s ownership.
- The dispute highlights how chip supply chains remain exposed to political and regulatory actions, with potential longer‑term effects on production and timing.

items.title: Vedanta patents lead- and tin-free alloy
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Vedanta's patent replaces lead and tin with *bismuth* to create a lead- and tin-free aluminium alloy, aligning with environmental standards and phasing out hazardous materials.
- Lab tests show: *8% higher tensile strength*, *21% higher yield strength*, *17% greater hardness*, and up to *30% smoother surface finish* vs conventional alloys.
- The R&D-led alloy targets automotive, electronics, and textiles, supporting *Make in India*, *Atmanirbhar Bharat*, and Vedanta's *Net Zero by 2050* goal.

items.title: Aimtron posts 112% revenue growth
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Aimtron's H1 FY26 revenue up *112.5%* to *₹1,225.8m*, EBITDA up *104.8%* to *₹301.1m*, and PAT up *81.4%* to *₹202.9m*, led by *defence*, *exports*, *IoT* and *ODM*. 
- Order book at *₹4,638.5m* as of 30 Sep 2025, including an *ODM contract* of *₹975.5m* and a domestic AI/IoT order of *₹460m*. 
- Raised *₹945.7m* via convertible warrants for greenfield expansion; earned *AS9100D* certification; MD calls FY26 a turning point.

items.title: HP plans to manufacture all PCs sold in India locally in 3-5 years
M&M, Escorts project 10–12% tractor growth FY26
items.author: Kriti Saraiya, ETAuto
items.summary:
- The Indian *tractor industry* is expected to post *double-digit growth* in *FY26*, with *M&M* and *Escorts Kubota* targeting *10–12%* expansion.
- Rural demand is buoyed by timely *monsoon*, higher *MSPs*, sustained government spend, and *GST cuts* that reduce the cost of *higher-horsepower tractors*.
- *Escorts Kubota* and *M&M* cite momentum in volumes, stockouts for *40–50 HP* models, and planned capex including a near-*Jewar* facility to support growth.

items.title: GST cuts offset US tariffs, boosting manufacturing growth
items.author: IANS
items.summary:
- GST rate cuts led to price reductions and increased household spending, *offsetting tariff-related pressure on India's exports*.
- HSBC Global Investment Research notes manufacturing output rising and Q3 CY25 growth at *7.2–7.4%*, with domestic orders supporting growth.
- Exports to the US slipped due to weakness in *jewellery*, crustaceans and textiles, but overall shipments stayed steady thanks to strength in *non-US markets* and high‑tech services.

items.title: India needs advanced tech to boost manufacturing: PHDCCI CEO
items.summary: - *PHDCCI* CEO says India must adopt advanced technologies to strengthen its manufacturing ecosystem and align with the *Viksit Bharat* vision by 2047.\n- An MoU between *PHDCCI* and the Busan Chamber will deepen bilateral trade in *manufacturing*, *clean energy*, *digital tech*, and logistics.\n- With 1.4 billion people and over 65 million MSMEs, India offers vast opportunities for Korean firms in *manufacturing*, *green tech*, and infrastructure.

items.title: Low prices of steel problem for small companies: Secretary
TABP Snacks and Beverages raises $3 million from LC Nueva, others
Dassault doubles India engineering footprint
items.summary:
- Dassault Aviation expands its Pune Engineering Center, doubling capacity to over *150 engineers* and deepening *local expertise* for internal operations and its global supply chain.
- The move strengthens *local design, engineering, and industrial capabilities* in line with India's *Make in India* and defence indigenisation goals by expanding partnerships with Indian suppliers.
- It also underpins offset commitments linked to the *Rafale contract* with the Indian Air Force, underscoring Dassault's long-term *offset obligations*.

items.title: Govt launches 3rd round of PLI scheme for speciality sector to attract investment in sector
Ambuja Cements aims to lower costs, raise production by 2028
Third round of PLI for specialty steel launched
items.author: ET Infra Desk
items.summary:
- *The government launched the third round (PLI 1.2) of the Production-Linked Incentive scheme for specialty steel*, announced by Union Minister H. D. Kumaraswamy. 
- Since inception, the scheme has attracted about ₹43,874 crore in investment commitments and created 30,760 direct jobs; by Sep 2025, first two rounds had ₹22,973 crore invested and 13,284 jobs. 
- The third round targets advanced categories, opens opportunities for **MSMEs** and existing producers upgrading capacity, and aligns with **Atmanirbhar Bharat Abhiyan** and **Net Zero 2070** goals — 'to produce steel for India, and supply the world from India'.

items.title: Berger Paints Q2 profit down 23% at ₹206 crore
Vedanta Aluminium: 8.96% GHG drop; 1.5 GW renewables by 2030
items.summary:
- Vedanta Aluminium reduced its *GHG emission intensity* by 8.96% since FY21 and plans to source *1,500 MW of renewable power* by 2030 via long-term *PPAs*.
- The company achieved *100% fly ash utilization* and recycled 14.6 million tonnes of waste in FY25, producing 2.42 million tonnes of aluminium with *zero environmental non-compliance*.
- It also partnered with *GAIL Gas* to supply natural gas to the Jharsuguda smelter, a move expected to cut over *47,000 tonnes of CO2* annually.

items.title: PHDCCI, Busan Chamber sign MoU to strengthen India–South Korea trade ties
Eurobond expands into Europe with launch of Eurobond Europe
Gopichand Hinduja dies in London at 85
items.summary:
- Gopichand Hinduja, chairman of the *Hinduja Group*, died in London at age 85.
- He led the family business from May 2023 after his elder brother Srichand Hinduja's passing, steering expansion across banking, energy, automotive, and other sectors.
- The Hinduja Group, with around 200,000 employees and notable properties in London, marks the end of an era for a cross‑border business dynasty.

items.title: Allcargo Terminals Q2: PAT flat, revenue up 6%
items.summary:
- *PAT* for Q2 stood at ₹11.3 crore, nearly the same as ₹11.32 crore last year, while *revenue* rose 6% to ₹207.16 crore.
- *Total income* rose to ₹209.63 crore from ₹197.38 crore year ago, with *revenue from operations* at ₹207.16 crore.
- For H1 FY26, consolidated *revenue* was ₹394.41 crore and *PAT* ₹20.41 crore, vs ₹20.89 crore prior year.

items.title: Samsung SDI eyes Tesla ESS supply deal
items.summary:
- Samsung SDI is in talks to supply *Energy Storage System* (ESS) batteries to **Tesla** in a deal reportedly worth around 3 trillion won ($2.11 billion).
- If signed, the agreement would reinforce Tesla's efforts to diversify away from China for key components, following recent sourcing deals with South Korean suppliers such as Samsung Electronics and LG Energy Solution.
- Korea Economic Daily reported the potential three-year ESS supply arrangement.

items.title: Schneider Electric names Amit Sharma as VP for Greater India
items.summary: - **Schneider Electric** appoints *Amit Sharma* as VP – **Power Products** and **Digital Energy** for **Greater India**, with full P&L responsibility.\n- Sharma has nearly three decades of experience, including 15 years at Schneider Electric and prior roles at ABB.\n- The move underscores Schneider Electric’s focus on leadership development and India’s role in its digital transformation strategy.

items.title: L&T–BEL rope in Dynamatic for AMCA fighter project
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- The *L&T*, *BEL*, and *DTL* consortium with *Dynamatic Technologies* will deliver key systems for the *AMCA* fifth‑gen fighter. 
- The tie‑up aims to strengthen domestic capabilities in advanced aerospace manufacturing for India’s *ADA/DRDO*-led program. 
- Executives say the partnership will redefine the *Indian aerospace ecosystem* by enabling design, development and production of critical structures.

items.title: Berger Paints names Amardeep Jain as VP – Manufacturing
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Berger Paints appointed *Amardeep Jain* as Vice President and Group Head – Manufacturing, effective **3 November 2025**, with formal charge on **1 December 2025** after induction.
- Jain is a *chemical engineer* from *IIT Delhi* with two decades of experience in the paint and process industry.
- The appointment follows the demise of *Rajesh Kumar Tiwari* on 13 September 2025, who previously held the position.

items.title: Tata Chemicals Q2 profit falls 18% to ₹219 crore
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Q2 revenue declined 3% to *₹3,877 crore* with EBITDA at *₹537 crore* and PAT before exceptional items at *₹219 crore*. 
- Standalone revenue rose 19% to *₹1,204 crore*, with EBITDA up 67% to *₹240 crore* and PAT from continuing operations at *₹178 crore*. 
- Consolidated H1 FY26 revenue stood at *₹7,596 crore*, EBITDA *₹1,186 crore*, and PAT before exceptional items *₹535 crore*, while net debt was *₹5,583 crore*.

items.title: Blue Cloud Softech inks $150 mn deal with Israel partner to build indigenous edge-AI chips
How Jeh Aerospace is making India matter in global aerospace manufacturing
Microsoft to invest over $15 billion in UAE, secures US export licenses for Nvidia chips
Microsoft signs $9.7B AI chips deal with IREN
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *Five-year* deal worth **$9.7B** between Microsoft and IREN to access *Nvidia GPUs* to scale *AI computing capacity* without building new data centers or extra power.
- Nvidia processors will be deployed in phases through 2026 at IREN sites, including the 750‑MW *Childress, Texas* campus, with liquid-cooled data centers delivering ~200 MW IT capacity.
- Cash upfront via Microsoft prepayments will help fund part of the *$5.8B Dell deal*, as the AI *capacity crunch* accelerates demand for chips.

items.title: HP plans to manufacture all PCs sold in India locally in 3-5 years
Cipla to fully acquire Inzpera Healthscience
items.summary:
- **Cipla** to acquire 100% equity of *Inzpera Healthscience* for around ₹111 crore, signaling a strategic expansion in the *paediatric* pharma space.
- The enterprise value of Inzpera is about ₹120 crore, with a purchase consideration of ₹110.65 crore for equity shares and non-convertible redeemable preference shares.
- The deal aims to combine Inzpera's paediatric portfolio with Cipla's distribution network to drive growth and scalability.

items.title: India's bioeconomy to reach $300B by 2030: NITI Aayog
items.summary:
- India’s bioeconomy—covering *agriculture*, *forestry*, *fisheries* and *aquaculture*—is projected to reach **$300B** by 2030 per a NITI Aayog report.
- The report ties a robust agricultural system to national sovereignty and *food security*, framing farming as a key engine of growth.
- It envisions frontier tech—**climate-resilient seeds**, *digital twins*, **precision agriculture**, *agentic AI*, and advanced mechanisation—and personalized farmer archetypes to boost productivity and rural prosperity.

items.title: Hinduja Group to invest ₹20,000 cr in Andhra's energy & EV
items.summary:
- The Hinduja Group will invest **₹20,000 crore** in Andhra Pradesh in phases, targeting **energy** and **EV** sectors. 
- The plan includes expanding Visakhapatnam's power capacity by 1,600 MW, plus solar and wind projects in Rayalaseema and an **EV manufacturing plant** at Mallavalli. 
- A statewide network of electric charging stations will be created in collaboration with the government to boost *green transport* and position Andhra as a renewable-energy hub.

items.title: Hind Rectifiers starts copper conductors at Sinnar plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Hind Rectifiers completed *backward integration* and started commercial production of specialised copper conductors at its *Sinnar plant* with a capex of ₹56 crore.
- The new line targets *Continuously Transposed Conductors*, *Enamelled Paper Insulated Copper Conductor*, and *Paper Insulated Copper Conductor* to bolster traction transformers and export potential.
- The move aims to *streamline the supply chain*, *reduce dependence on external vendors*, and ensure uninterrupted transformer production, potentially avoiding penalties from Indian Railways.

items.title: Manaksia Coated Metals signs ₹500 cr MoUs
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- *Manaksia Coated Metals* has signed MoUs worth *₹500 crore* with *European clients* to supply up to *50,000 MT* of steel products over the next 12 months.
- The MoUs cover *pre-painted steel coils*, *Alu-Zinc coated coils*, and *galvanized steel*, expanding the company’s footprint in Europe and boosting export revenue, which accounted for 70% in H1 FY26.
- *Karan Agrawal* notes capacity expansion to 236,000 MT, a new Color Coating Line, and a 7.0 MW renewable energy project to enhance growth and cost efficiency.

items.title: Experts call for policy action to unlock Odisha’s bauxite potential
India's first 220kV mobile GIS delivered to Power Grid
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- TTDI delivered India's first indigenous 220kV *mobile GIS* to **Power Grid Corp**, marking a milestone in *Make in India* and boosting grid *flexibility* and resilience.
- The modular **Connect-Disconnect-Redeploy** design enables fast deployment on standard trailers for *temporary power evacuation* and *substation augmentation*.
- TTDI plans follow-on milestones, with a planned **400kV** mobile GIS in Aug 2026 and a **132kV** m-GIS in Nov 2025, strengthening the nation's high-voltage infrastructure.

items.title: Hafele-backed Isler opens appliance manufacturing facility in Greater Noida
Aluminium association seeks 15% duty, quality norms to protect domestic industry
WAE receives ZED Gold certification for sustainable manufacturing
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- **ZED Gold Certification** from **MSME** for *sustainable*, quality-driven manufacturing.
- It recognises **predictive maintenance** and *data-led quality analytics* to reduce **environmental impact** and boost efficiency.
- Executives say this demonstrates that responsible manufacturing can drive **long-term competitiveness** and *innovation*.

items.title: Fabex Steel Structures commissions ₹120-crore manufacturing unit in Telangana
Loom Solar expands manufacturing and product portfolio at REI 2025
Black Gold Recycling acquires majority stake in Reteck Envirotech
Cipla to acquire Inzpera Healthsciences for ₹110cr
items.summary:
- Cipla to acquire a 100% stake in **Inzpera Healthsciences** for about ₹110.65 crore after working capital adjustments.
- Inzpera, a paediatric pharma and wellness firm, has an enterprise value around ₹120 crore and posted FY2024–25 turnover of ₹26.75 crore.
- The deal aims to combine Inzpera’s paediatric portfolio with Cipla’s distribution network to accelerate growth in the segment.

items.title: French manufacturing sector remains in contraction in October, PMI shows
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- *PMI rose to 48.8 in October but remains below the 50 threshold, signaling contraction in France's manufacturing sector.*
- *Political instability and weak demand weigh on output and new orders, with export orders declining only slowly since April and employment edging higher.*
- *About 30% of firms expect output to fall next year as backlogs surge—the fastest since May 2022—while input price inflation eases.*

items.title: German manufacturing remains sluggish in October, PMI shows
items.summary: - The *HCOB Germany Manufacturing PMI* inched to 49.6, staying below 50 and signaling ongoing contraction.\n- Output rose only marginally as *new orders* improved slightly, but *export demand* remained weak.\n- Employment fell for the 28th consecutive month and *business expectations* weakened further.
